name: the Wizard of Ooze
description:
You name is Hero.

You have been taken prisoner and interned at the old Riverfork Keep, now occupied by the villainous Wizard of Ooze, a foul-smelling, evil Ooze, that is a Wizard, and hates everyone. Even other oozes.

Stripped of your gear and your levels, you've been beaten to 20% of your hit points and mana, and dumped down into The Depths, below The Dungeon, to be eaten alive by oozes that slink around down there, subsisting off scraps and bits of garbage and stuff, eating anything or anyone that falls down through the cracks from the levels above.

Search The Depths, restore your health from the mana pools of water about the cave, re-arm yourself from the discarded chests you find, and fight the oozes to escape. (You might want to start with the blue ooze first.)

The 'Wizard of Ooze' is a 10-level JRPG Dungeon Crawler in the style of the 80's Twenty-Five-Cent Arcade Video Games.  Proceed level-by-level, fighting monsters, traversing mazes, solving puzzles, collecting items and armor and ultimately defeating the Wizard of Ooze.  It's half Pac-Man, half Donkey Kong, a pinch of Zelda, and a whole lot of fun.

This is my first game with the RGP Maker (MV) engine. And as a proof of concept I wanted to learn the engine, create a 10-level game in an Arcade style, figure out some specific mechanics not commonly showcased like 2-D towers, "falling", Arcade style movement, projectiles, faux-perspective, and how to engineer complex level-based puzzles. I also wanted to find a way to include self-promotion advertising that would not be intrusive to game-level screens and that could be turned off in a pay-for version.

In a fast as possible play-through it takes 1 hours and 45 minutes to complete the game.  Having to solve puzzles, figure out secrets, and learning game mechanics will extend game play time.  

The game contains:

• 10 Levels made up from 16 Screens
• 30 Enemies
• 5 Unique Armor Sets with Graphics
• 5 Secret Levels
• 9 Level Up Screens with Hints and Ads
• Ability to Turn Off Hints in the Level Up Screens
• Unlimited Deaths
• New and Custom Graphics
• New and Custom Audio
